_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:27:03 using v2.0
title: How has the proportion of category A calls attended within 19 minutes changed?
analysis_commentary:
As well as the A8 standard, where 75% of Category A (Red1 and Red 2) ambulance calls should receive a response within eight minutes, there is an additional standard where 95% of the non-immediately-life-threatening calls should be responded to within 19 minutes (the A19 standard).

Over the time period recorded there has only been one occasion where this standard has been breached, December 2012, where 94.6% of Category A (Red1 and Red 2) ambulance calls were responded to within 19 minutes.

However, there has been a steady decline in the proportion of Category A calls responded to within 19 minutes over the time period overall (despite monthly variations). The proportion has decreased from 97.3% in April 2011 to 95.4% in December 2013.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
